questions.stem: In which organizational structure does the project manager have little to no formal authority and must rely primarily on interpersonal skills to achieve project objectives?
questions.explanation: In a functional organization, the functional manager has authority and the project manager has little to no formal power, relying mainly on referent power.

questions.stem: A project manager is referred to as a project expeditor and works part time with no authority over resources. What organizational structure is most likely in place?
questions.explanation: The title project expeditor and lack of authority are characteristics of a functional organization.

questions.stem: In which organizational structure is power shared approximately equally between the project manager and the functional manager?
questions.explanation: A balanced matrix organization shares authority between the project manager and the functional manager.

questions.stem: Which organizational structure is most likely to experience conflict due to dual reporting relationships?
questions.explanation: Matrix organizations create dual authority, which increases the likelihood of conflict.

questions.stem: A project manager has full authority over budget, schedule, and team members who are assigned full time to the project. Which structure best fits this description?
questions.explanation: In a projectized organization, the project manager has full authority and team members report directly to the PM.

questions.stem: Which role title is most commonly associated with a weak matrix organization?
questions.explanation: In a weak matrix, the project manager is often called a project coordinator and has limited authority.

questions.stem: Who controls the project budget in a functional organization?
questions.explanation: In a functional organization, budget authority resides with the functional manager.

questions.stem: Which organizational structure provides the strongest communication channels but may result in duplication of resources?
questions.explanation: Projectized organizations offer strong communication and authority but may duplicate resources across projects.

questions.stem: In which organizational structure are team members loyal primarily to their functional department rather than the project?
questions.explanation: In functional organizations, team members report to functional managers and prioritize departmental goals.

questions.stem: A project manager has authority similar to a functional manager but still shares some control. What structure is most likely?
questions.explanation: In a strong matrix, the project manager has more authority than the functional manager but does not have total control.

questions.stem: Which organizational structure is least suitable when resources are scarce and cost control is critical?
questions.explanation: Projectized organizations require dedicated resources and can increase costs when resources are scarce.

questions.stem: In which structure does the project manager most often work part time?
questions.explanation: In a weak matrix, the project manager role is typically part time.

questions.stem: Who is ultimately responsible for project success regardless of organizational structure?
questions.explanation: The project manager is responsible for meeting approved baselines and achieving project objectives in all structures.

questions.stem: Which structure allows the best sharing of scarce resources across multiple projects?
questions.explanation: Matrix structures allow scarce resources to be shared across multiple projects.

questions.stem: A project manager must negotiate for resources and has limited authority. Which structure best fits this situation?
questions.explanation: In a functional structure, the project manager must negotiate for resources and has little authority.

questions.stem: Which organizational structure typically results in slower decision making due to multiple approval layers?
questions.explanation: Functional organizations rely on hierarchical decision making, which can slow responses.

questions.stem: In which structure are team members more loyal to the project than their department?
questions.explanation: In projectized organizations, team members report directly to the project manager and are loyal to the project.

questions.stem: Which organizational structure creates the greatest need for conflict management skills?
questions.explanation: Matrix structures involve dual reporting relationships, increasing conflict risk.

questions.stem: What is a key advantage of a functional organization?
questions.explanation: Functional organizations allow specialists to share knowledge and be used efficiently across work.

questions.stem: Which structure provides the project manager with the greatest level of authority?
questions.explanation: Projectized organizations give the project manager full authority over the project.
